result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ghatani A Rupert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ghatani A Rupert in court.  Attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Attorney Bobot could not appear in person, called into court. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Adjustment Number: 22A 087972,
Payable Number: 1030669,
Receipt Number: 22RP035992,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Ghatani A Rupert in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Plaisted to represent defendant  at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month. Repayment to begin October 1st, 2022.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ghatani A Rupert
Current: 3124 N 51st Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 4250 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PV and KV.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ghatani A Rupert in court.    Josh Kather, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge , Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@2:30pm
